review: For the money, this is useful  for any Amazon Prime member who wants to watch video on a TV instead of a computer.  While not shown in the picture, the Fire TV Stick requires a small 5-volt power supply (included) as well as an open HDMI connector on the TV.Living in rural OR, we have rather dismal DSL service.  At first, I found that Fire TV Stick would not deliver continuous viewing without stopping frequently for buffering.  After I changed the setting on it from 1080 to 720 scan, it began working fine.  However, other providers, such as Hulu, don't work nearly as well for us as does Amazon content.  It usually stops twice during the opening to buffer, then runs for the rest of the program without interruption.I spent my first weekend with the Fire TV Stick binge-watching all the seasons of "Downton Abbey," which are all available on Amazon Prime.  Yes, as my spouse claims, it's just a soap opera with fancy accents, but I still love it!While I haven't tried it, my guess is that it would operate fine in 1080 mode with faster internet service -- which you probably already have.Recommended.
